meaningMnemonic:
You know 変 means "change," but it can also mean "strange." So a <kanji>strange</kanji> <kanji>occurrence</kanji> is an incident that is unlikely. In other words, an <vocabulary>unexpected incident</vocabulary> or an <vocabulary>unusual incident</vocabulary>.

変事 is a formal word used to describe sudden and unusual occurrences that disrupt normal conditions, such as natural disasters, emergencies, or crises. You won't see this word often, but may still come across it in formal writing.

With 変事, think of how the 変 comes first to emphasize the strangeness of the incident.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
